verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329>, A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>. Hold not thy peace <WH2790>, O God <WH430> of my praise <WH8416>;

For the mouth <WH6310> of the wicked <WH7563> and the mouth <WH6310> of the deceitful <WH4820> are opened <WH6605> against me: they have spoken <WH1696> against me with a lying <WH8267> tongue <WH3956>.
They compassed <WH5437> me about also with words <WH1697> of hatred <WH8135>; and fought <WH3898> against me without a cause <WH2600>.
For my love <WH160> they are my adversaries <WH7853>: but I give myself unto prayer <WH8605>.
And they have rewarded <WH7760> me evil <WH7451> for good <WH2896>, and hatred <WH8135> for my love <WH160>.
Set <WH6485> thou a wicked man <WH7563> over him: and let Satan <WH7854> stand <WH5975> at his right hand <WH3225>.
When he shall be judged <WH8199>, let him be <WH3318> condemned <WH7563>: and let his prayer <WH8605> become sin <WH2401>.
Let his days <WH3117> be few <WH4592>; and let another <WH312> take <WH3947> his office <WH6486>.
Let his children <WH1121> be fatherless <WH3490>, and his wife <WH802> a widow <WH490>.
Let his children <WH1121> be continually <WH5128> vagabonds <WH5128>, and beg <WH7592>: let them seek <WH1875> their bread also out of their desolate places <WH2723>.
Let the extortioner <WH5383> catch <WH5367> all that he hath; and let the strangers <WH2114> spoil <WH962> his labour <WH3018>.
Let there be none to extend <WH4900> mercy <WH2617> unto him: neither let there be any to favour <WH2603> his fatherless children <WH3490>.
Let his posterity <WH319> be cut off <WH3772>; and in the generation <WH1755> following <WH312> let their name <WH8034> be blotted out <WH4229>.
Let the iniquity <WH5771> of his fathers <WH1> be remembered <WH2142> with the LORD <WH3068>; and let not the sin <WH2403> of his mother <WH517> be blotted out <WH4229>.
Let them be before the LORD <WH3068> continually <WH8548>, that he may cut off <WH3772> the memory <WH2143> of them from the earth <WH776>.

Because that he remembered <WH2142> not to shew <WH6213> mercy <WH2617>, but persecuted <WH7291> the poor <WH6041> and needy <WH34> man <WH376>, that he might even slay <WH4191> the broken <WH3512> in heart <WH3824>.
As he loved <WH157> cursing <WH7045>, so let it come <WH935> unto him: as he delighted <WH2654> not in blessing <WH1293>, so let it be far <WH7368> from him.

As he clothed <WH3847> himself with cursing <WH7045> like as with his garment <WH4055>, so let it come <WH935> into his bowels <WH7130> like water <WH4325>, and like oil <WH8081> into his bones <WH6106>.
Let it be unto him as the garment <WH899> which covereth <WH5844> him, and for a girdle <WH4206> wherewith he is girded <WH2296> continually <WH8548>.
Let this be the reward <WH6468> of mine adversaries <WH7853> from the LORD <WH3068>, and of them that speak <WH1696> evil <WH7451> against my soul <WH5315>.
But do <WH6213> thou for me, O GOD <WH3069> the Lord <WH136>, for thy name's <WH8034> sake: because thy mercy <WH2617> is good <WH2896>, deliver <WH5337> thou me.
For I am poor <WH6041> and needy <WH34>, and my heart <WH3820> is wounded <WH2490> within <WH7130> me.
I am gone <WH1980> like the shadow <WH6738> when it declineth <WH5186>: I am tossed up and down <WH5287> as the locust <WH697>.
My knees <WH1290> are weak <WH3782> through fasting <WH6685>; and my flesh <WH1320> faileth <WH3584> of fatness <WH8081>.
I became also a reproach <WH2781> unto them: when they looked <WH7200> upon me they shaked <WH5128> their heads <WH7218>.
Help <WH5826> me, O LORD <WH3068> my God <WH430>: O save <WH3467> me according to thy mercy <WH2617>:
That they may know <WH3045> that this is thy hand <WH3027>; that thou, LORD <WH3068>, hast done <WH6213> it.
Let them curse <WH7043>, but bless <WH1288> thou: when they arise <WH6965>, let them be ashamed <WH954>; but let thy servant <WH5650> rejoice <WH8055>.
Let mine adversaries <WH7853> be clothed <WH3847> with shame <WH3639>, and let them cover <WH5844> themselves with their own confusion <WH1322>, as with a mantle <WH4598>.
I will greatly <WH3966> praise <WH3034> the LORD <WH3068> with my mouth <WH6310>; yea, I will praise <WH1984> him among <WH8432> the multitude <WH7227>.
For he shall stand <WH5975> at the right hand <WH3225> of the poor <WH34>, to save <WH3467> him from those that condemn <WH8199> his soul <WH5315>.
